item.title: Long grass with grass seeds all over the park, 21st June
item.description:
The grass needs to be cut regularly and the grass removed. My dog had to be sedated last week to remove 2 grass seeds from his ear at a cost of £238. He has an ulcerated eardrum. If it was perforated it would have cost £1000++ The park is mainly used for by dog owners due to it being secure. There is a good dog walking community and it would be a shame if we stopped using the park due to the long grass
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanhope Grove, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven paving, 21st June
item.description:
The ally which joins South Hill Road and Highfield Drive, which is used daily by hundreds of school children and adults is very uneven the entire length. I have 3 children all have tripped over raised uneven paving slabs. This week on Wednesday my daughter fell, cut her face and chipped her front tooth. It is a regular occurrence for children and adults to trip up, especially during busy school periods.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: 12 North Emd, 21st June
item.description:
These works were supposed to finish on the 20th June, the residents bays have been out of action for 3 weeks, with only people working for 3 days, the workers have left the road and pavements in a disgusting mess, the pavements and roads are very dirty and need cleaning, the works should have been finished yesterday
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Allotment extremely overgrown, 21st June
item.description:
The above photos are of my side of the fence that I share with the allotment. As you can see they are extremely overgrown and destroying my fence. I have lived here 3 years and this has been an on going problem. I did report it when I moved in, a Bexley worker contacted me and assured me the allotment would get cleared which it did but also he would add it to the gardening rotation so it wouldn’t get out of control again. As you can see this isn’t the case, I never see anyone in there attending to the ground. I have already had to replace 2 fence panels because of this issue. Please can someone contact me regarding this issue and arrange for it to be taken care of. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Emes Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Here’s an idea, 21st June
item.description:
There’s an obvious issue in the whole of London with street fouling. Probably predominantly from the homeless. Why doesn’t our illustrious Mayor put some of the colossal amount of fines he’s getting from ULEZ, parking, and for the poor sod’s fined for creeping 1 inch into a yellow box junction, into providing 24 hour , clean, staffed, free showers and toilets. Perhaps that would be a small step into changing once was a lovely clean city, into the shithole it is today. It’s not rocket science
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goodwins Court, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Damage - smashed glass or panels / jagged metal edges on shelter

item.title: Deli Nene, 21st June
item.description:
Deli Nene CONSTANTLY obstruct the pavement with their menu stand, and sandwich boards. I have often asked them to move them back towards their shopfront and give pedestrians a chance, but it has no ongoing effect. Deli Nene probably take up two-thirds of a very narrow pavement, disregarding local pedestrians. One day, it is certain that a pedestrian stepping into the road to make progress on this obstructed, narrow pavement will have a road accident. If Bromley Council have given permission for this ongoing obstruction, then permission should be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
